sub_title: Psychologist | Research | Writing | Master candidate RM Clinical and Developmental Psychopathology
summary:
Welcome to my profile where you will see and realize that besides being a passionate and creative professional with skills in research, teaching and collaborative work, I also develop in other domains of life. 

You will also notice that not all professionals have the opportunity to exercise their degree in a single, linear, defined way, but they still can be up-to-date, professional, be open to learn different things, bring different/diverse/refreshing ideas and they never stop living up to their own standards of honesty, dignity and kindness. 

Professionally, I like to work in challenging environments, with people from different sociocultural
contexts and in the clinical-social and educational research fields to achieve innovative synergies. I also advocate for work spaces with high psychological safety. This is, spaces where actions speak louder than words, and there is absolute respect and encouragement for Self-determination and Individual/Collective Dignity. 

My main topics of interest in research are: human psychopathology, psychological development, education,  co-creation, social determinants of health, meta-analysis, human rights, fascism and ideologies influences in daily life. 

For academic writing: https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Paula-Quijano-2 <<< 
Bi-annual in Innsbruck as Aurora student Ambassador: https://vu.nl/en/about-vu/more-about/bi-annual-in-innsbruck 

Enjoy the reading Ü.

profile_positions.description: I coordinated the research portfolio within the Green Office at VU. I  facilitated sustainability research made by students at the VU. Among other projects, I coordinated the Green Action Lab and the academic journal Science for Sustainability (for students).
profile_positions.title: Research Officer/ Student assistant

profile_positions.description:
I joined an inspiring programme supported by prominent VU alumni currently working in meaningful organizations and companies. The speakers, programme, fellow classmates, the coaching and the topic of the business case for 2021-2022 were very important to strengthen my professional confidence. 
The Business case I took part in was for The Heineken Experience Museum, in Amsterdam. The main questions our team worked on were: who are the locals in Amsterdam and how The Heineken Experience Museum can be meaningful to them?.  
We built the case with theoretical insights, interviews to competitors and at the end we delivered a succinct and meaningful report and presentation to the people of The Heineken Experience Museum.
profile_positions.title: The boardroom VU

profile_positions.description:
Within the frame of my master programme, I chose the elective in advanced research training to deepen my scientific skills beyond my curriculum. 
Under the supervision of the PhD candidate Anne de Graaff (field supervisor) I conducted a small Individual Patient Data Meta Analysis (IPDMA) on the Efficacy of Problem Management Plus in Syrian refugees and Arab-Speakers with elevated psychological distress living in Europe and the Middle East (preliminary results). 
During this time I learnt how research partners collaborate and grasped on managerial aspects of research such as data sharing regulations. I learnt how to do data harmonization, mixed effect linear regression models analysis and interpretation in R and enhanced my scientific writing abilities.
profile_positions.title: Advanced research training

profile_positions.description:
During the pandemic, I found myself exploring diverse avenues as freelancer and in self-actualization.

*Airbnb private rental accommodation: I was the bookkeeper and administrator of a rental with 15 studios. 
 
*Teleperformance/Microsoft: As a customer service representative for Microsoft. I assisted customers globally on billing, accounts, and technical support. I boosted my English communication skills, patience, and enhanced my resourcefulness for problem-solving. 

*Post-doctorate researcher's assistant: I designed online courses, booklets and handbooks for the training of leadership, collaboration, solidarity and social business innovation skills among Rural Change Agents in Spain. I widened my comprehension of Sustainability, and I also gained further knowledge in content creation and strategies for education of interpersonal skills. 

*I studied and worked on:
Basics of programming (starting with Python)-online.
Public health (epidemiology and tools for research)- online.
Principles of design thinking- online.
Human rights- online.
Wrote an autoethnography on my experience taking the COVID-19 vaccine during the phase 3 trial of Johnson & Johnson.
profile_positions.title: Lead Project Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
I executed pedagogical activities of socialization, emotional recognition and symbolic play framed in the
context and interests of the beneficiaries -children and teenagers from gipsy families. I completed pedagogical orientation for instructors and composed a pedagogical plan for teaching maths and reading from the meaningful learning paradigm.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer in Psychology

profile_positions.description: I co-authored the document for revision of the progress of the peace process in Colombia. From analyses of information obtained in the field, meetings with government representatives and public study documents, a final report was conveyed regarding the impact of the internal conflict on childhood and adolescence within the peace agreements.
profile_positions.title: Junior Professional researcher

profile_positions.description:
I facilitated the work of community mothers of the city of Cali by promoting effective 
community participation in the activation of attention routes and by mentoring activities oriented to psychological development of the beneficiaries (children). Likewise, I helped enriching the School for Parents to encourage care and upbringing practices and strengthen parents commitment to guarantee children's rights.
profile_positions.title: Psychosocial support Junior professional

profile_positions.description:
I took part in the training to be a teacher within the group Teach For All, Colombia. I was selected to join a 2 months training that allowed me to get a grasp of the basics on theoretical and practical matters of teaching and pedagogy in the Colombian context (rural & urban). 

----- Socio-Economic context----
After receiving my degree as a professional in Psychology (a degree that truthly educated me, and also allows me to move further in education, companies, research, counseling, etc), I went on exploring professional options that would allow me to do something meaningful and travel. While actively job-hunting as a Psychologist, I also applied to different positions to be a teacher, one of my dearest dreams.
As is well known by all, teaching is an underpaid job in many places, and in Colombia this is not the exception. Even though I was willing to take a teaching job in a remote place, with a salary significantly lower than the minimum wage, being a Psychologist without much professional experience (although this program seeks to give an entry to the work-world to many) was problematic and I did not get many offers to join a school. The reason? Some cannot see (not their fault) what a Psychologist can offer to education beyond diagnosis and tests. I was not the only one that did not got fair offers. Others took whatever was there in hope the conditions would improve in the future. 
At the end, I decided to continue seeking job in my main area with the hope I would find many other ways to teach.
profile_positions.title: Internship Trainee in Teaching

profile_positions.description:
I collaborated in the recruitment and selection process of the human talent division. I completed applicant´s assessments for vacancies at the operational, technical and professional level. I advised the development and implementation of a project to reduce job turnover of security guards, by enhancing interview skills in
evaluating the reliability trait at work.
profile_positions.title: Human Resources Intern

profile_positions.description:
I taught basic English and French to children between 5-7 years old. I fostered literacy and social behavior
processes, strengthening the school leveling of several students who presented difficulties in both domains.
profile_positions.title: Support Teacher
